pull.title: doc: Bump to Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 in build-windows.md
pull.body: Windows starts to provide Ubuntu 18.04 WSL, it can be downloaded from Microsoft Store.

events.body:
Concept ACK.

There are more references to 17.10 that could be bumped?

Concept ACK
This will need a few more updates though. For example Ubuntu and Ubuntu 18.04 are two different items in the Windows Store, so we should link to 18.04 from here.
I had the impression that we only support windows cross builds for bionic, due to qt 5.9. So might as well remove all previous versions/workarounds?
According to @MarcoFalke's comment, removed all other distros except for Ubuntu 18.04. Also changed the Ubuntu 18.04 WSL link according to @fanquake's comment.

Thanks @ken2812221 . Instructions are looking simpler now. Was going to run through a build but VirtualBox has crashed twice while building depends using 18.04 WSL.. Will ACK once I've got a build finished.
Concept ACK. I like this as it gets rid of a lot of confusing backwards compatibility cruft.

events.message:
doc: Bump to Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 in build-windows.md

Windows starts to provide Ubuntu 18.04 WSL, it can be downloaded from Microsoft Store.

events.body:
TestedACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13246/commits/9d4f9421a4898f75a4c49aaefaba2868de071d79

This is a good cleanup, less workarounds.

I've done a 64 bit depends build using WSL on a clean Windows 10 VM @ https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/6916024768ec57a00f54224640ab4e4871d2a30a
![wsl](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/40425978-75011ffa-5ecc-11e8-89f2-b1287ce0fd00.png)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -74,26 +69,11 @@ See also: [dependencies.md](dependencies.md).
 
 ## Building for 64-bit Windows
 
-The first step is to install the mingw-w64 cross-compilation tool chain. Due to different Ubuntu
-packages for each distribution and problems with the Xenial packages the steps for each are different.
-
-Common steps to install mingw32 cross compiler tool chain:
+The first step is to install the mingw-w64 cross-compilation tool chain.
 
     sudo apt install g++-mingw-w64-x86-64
 
-Ubuntu Trusty 14.04:
-
-    No further steps required
-
-Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 and Windows Subsystem for Linux <sup>[1](#footnote1),[2](#footnote2)</sup>:
-
-    sudo apt install software-properties-common
-    sudo add-apt-repository "deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu artful universe"
comments.body: Finally, no more need to install packages from a different version of ubuntu.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -38,10 +38,10 @@ To install WSL on Windows 10 with Fall Creators Update installed (version >= 162
   * Enable 'Windows Subsystem for Linux'
   * Click 'OK' and restart if necessary
 2. Install Ubuntu
-  * Open Microsoft Store and search for Ubuntu or use [this link](https://www.microsoft.com/store/productId/9NBLGGH4MSV6)
+  * Open Microsoft Store and search for "Ubuntu 18.04" or use [this link](https://www.microsoft.com/store/productId/9N9TNGVNDL3Q)
   * Click Install
 3. Complete Installation
-  * Open a cmd prompt and type "Ubuntu"
+  * Open a cmd prompt and type "Ubuntu1804"
comments.body: Will this stay this way? Or is this temporarily, until `1804` becomes the default

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ Below are some notes on how to build Bitcoin Core for Windows.
 
 The options known to work for building Bitcoin Core on Windows are:
 
-* On Linux using the [Mingw-w64](https://mingw-w64.org/doku.php) cross compiler tool chain. Ubuntu Trusty 14.04 is recommended
+* On Linux using the [Mingw-w64](https://mingw-w64.org/doku.php) cross compiler tool chain. Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 is recommended
comments.body: Please add that the steps in this document only apply for `18.04`. Only saying that it is recommended is not enough, as it means you'd still have to warn people against using `16.04`.

comments.diff_hunk:

   * Enable 'Windows Subsystem for Linux'
   * Click 'OK' and restart if necessary

   * Click Install
 3. Complete Installation
-  * Open a cmd prompt and type "Ubuntu"
+  * Open a cmd prompt and type "Ubuntu1804"
comments.body: I'm not sure, it's a different app in Microsoft Store now.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ Below are some notes on how to build Bitcoin Core for Windows.
 
 The options known to work for building Bitcoin Core on Windows are:
 
-* On Linux using the [Mingw-w64](https://mingw-w64.org/doku.php) cross compiler tool chain. Ubuntu Trusty 14.04 is recommended
+* On Linux using the [Mingw-w64](https://mingw-w64.org/doku.php) cross compiler tool chain. Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 is recommended

@@ -38,10 +38,10 @@ To install WSL on Windows 10 with Fall Creators Update installed (version >= 162
   * Enable 'Windows Subsystem for Linux'
   * Click 'OK' and restart if necessary
 2. Install Ubuntu
-  * Open Microsoft Store and search for Ubuntu or use [this link](https://www.microsoft.com/store/productId/9NBLGGH4MSV6)
+  * Open Microsoft Store and search for "Ubuntu 18.04" or use [this link](https://www.microsoft.com/store/productId/9N9TNGVNDL3Q)
   * Click Install
 3. Complete Installation
-  * Open a cmd prompt and type "Ubuntu"
+  * Open a cmd prompt and type "Ubuntu1804"
comments.body: There are multiple different Ubuntu "Apps" available in the Windows store, so I think this should be ok for now.
